page.title: 04NORTHAM CHURCH
page.content: St Margaret's Parish Church was opened on 1 June 1593. In 1844, Rev'd Isaac Gosset was appointed vicar and he found that the church was in very poor state. The roof was covered with a cheap and poor-quality slate which blew off in the slightest gale. He also disliked the pulpit despite the fact it dated from Jacobean times. There has been a church building on the site since the 12th century. To the north of the present church is a field called 'Sentry', thought to be a corruption of Sanctuary, suggesting the site of former places of worship.
